Speaker: first draft
Dialogue: October 20, 1986

Speaker: mom
Dialogue: For God's sake, Harold, can we please just get a taxi??

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: I'm trying to get a --  TAXI!!

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: We're going the wrong way.

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: Put that away. We'll look like tourists.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Seventh is that way.

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: I know where we are!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Hey, mister. Gimme a dollar?

Speaker: derelict
Dialogue: Mister. How about it. One dollar?  One dollar, man. Are you deaf? Are you deaf? -- Do you speak English??

Speaker: street punk
Dialogue: Do the kid a favor, lady. Don't scream.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Don't leave home without it.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Let's beat it, man. I don't like being up here.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What, scared of heights?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I dunno, man. After what happened to Johnny Gobs --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Look, Johnny Gobs got ripped and walked off a roof, all right? No big loss.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: That ain't what I heard. That ain't what I heard at all.  I heard the bat got him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Gimme a break, will you? Shut up...

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Five stories, straight down. There was no blood in the body.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No shit. It was all over the pavement.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: There was no blood, man.  My brother says... all the bad things you done... they come back and haunt you...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Listen to this. How old are you? There ain't no bat.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: My brother's a priest, man.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No wonder you're such a chickenshit. Now shut up.  There ain't no bat.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You shouldn'ta turned the gun on that kid, man. You shouldn'ta --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Do you want this money or don't you? Now shut up! Shut up --

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: I won't kill you. I want you to do me a favor.

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: ... it is no longer enough to go after the small-time punks and petty criminals who infest the streets of Gotham City. Crime and corruption must be attacked at the root!

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: If elected, my first act as district attorney will be to return an indictment against Boss Carl Grissom!

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: Together we can make Gotham city a safe place for decent people to live and work and play.

Speaker: jack napier
Dialogue: Decent people shouldn't live here. They'd be much happier someplace else.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Anything new?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: The usual gas. If this clown could lay a hand on Grissom... I would've had to kill him by now.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: If Grissom knew about us... he might kill you.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Don't think so, angel. I'm too valuable. That's the way I've planned it.  And besides, he doesn't know.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: You look just fine, Jack.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: ... I didn't ask.

Speaker: medic
Dialogue: That one there won't say a word. The other one's raving his head off.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: Variety, huh? The spice of life.

Speaker: patrolman
Dialogue: They found him hugging a drainpipe. He was scared to come off the roof.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Great, but tell me: is this another you-know-what? 'Cause if so, it's the third one this week.

Speaker: patrolman
Dialogue: I dunno. What's "what"?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Good answer. I'm gonna put you in for a commendation.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: Oh Christ, it's Knox.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Hiya, gents. This anything I should know about?

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: Nothing out of the routine.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: A bat, I tell you, a giant bat! He wanted me to do him a favor...!

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: No offense, boys, but these guys are seeing something up there.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: No comment. Print what you like.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Come on. One question. Is there a six-foot bat in Gotham City?

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You didn't show up.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: We had another bat sighting.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I'm sure that was vitally important. Listen: things are heating up. Someone is leaking information to Harvey Dent.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: I'm doing the best I can. If it's a problem --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Eckhardt... our problems are your problems.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: I'll work on it.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Very nice, Lieutenant. But a little ostentatious on a cop's salary, don't you think?

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: I answer to Grissom, punk. Not to you.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: You're a smart boy, Eckhardt. You should be thinking about the future.

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: Ambition.  Forget it, Jack. You'll never run that organization.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: And why's that?

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: You're a psycho, friend. You're an A-one crazy boy and Grissom knows it.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Here. Use mine.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: What have you got for me, Jerry?

Speaker: colleague
Dialogue: Hey Knox, you got a visitor.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: I'm real busy, Clark. Be a pal and dust him, okay?

Speaker: colleague
Dialogue: This one you might want to dust yourself.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: ... Vicki Vale.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: How'd you know it was me?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Honey -- I would know any randomly selected square inch of Vicki Vale.  If I had a good enough hint.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: A nice, restful vacation.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: God, a girl could get hurt doing this.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I do get hurt.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Got any more of those?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Nothing I'm at liberty to reveal here. What's new and hot in Gotham City?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: It's too good, Vick. We got a six- foot bat that swoops out of the night and preys on evildoers.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Evildoers, huh? Big or small?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Small so far. I mean -- they don't allow bats in boardrooms, do they.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Speaking of which... I hear the notorious Bruce Wayne is throwing a big do for the Harvey Dent campaign.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Yeah. Hottest ticket in town. Every law'n'order freak in the city's gonna be there.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Well, I'm starving. Will you at least buy me a hamburger?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Yes, but please -- be gentle.

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Nine points ahead in the new poll. I don't like the way this is shaping up.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: We can always pop him. -- Or pop someone close to him.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: Let's feed him to the bat.

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: He's going after our front companies. Specifically Ace Chemical. Which would tie us in with Councilman Kane, Senator Miller... on up the line.  We have to clean out our files before the subpoena comes down.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: How do we go? The usual fire?

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: I'm thinking break-in. Trash the office, remove the relevant documents...

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: "Industrial espionage."

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: That's right. And Jack --  I'd like you to handle this operation personally.

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Hello, sweetheart. I wonder if you'd mind waiting in the other room.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Why do you need me to handle a simple break-in?

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Because I want someone I can trust.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Jack. Don't forget your lucky deck.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: How high up would you say that is?

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: I'd say about thirty feet, sir.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: You know, if you cut your bathroom in half, you'd have my apartment.

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: Which bathroom is that, air?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: The small one.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Some. I am a rich bitch, remember.  I'm quoting.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess we move in different circles. -- Though I did meet a one-eyed pimp last week.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Commissioner Gordon! What do you hear from our pointy-eared friend?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Knox, for the ninth time, and you can quote me -- there is no bat.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Aww, Commissioner. There's gotta be one honest cop in Gotham city.

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: How's your luck, Jim?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Mr. Dent. What's your stand on winged vigilantes?

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: Mr. Knox, I think we have enough real problems in this city without worrying about ghosts and goblins and Halloween characters.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: My question is, where does one man get all this junk.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: All over the world. They say he spends most of the year overseas -- until recently, anyway.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Holy shit...

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Just what I've heard. Rich. Reclusive. Old money and lots of it.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Likes to kill?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Women find him magnetic.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: I bet they like him for his big charity balls.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: That, and the sweet smell of two hundred million bucks.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Well, you know me. The more they've got, the less they're worth.  This guy must be the most worthless man in America.

Speaker: bruce wayne
Dialogue: You disappoint me. Why not the world?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: I assume in my usual charming manner I've just insulted the host.  Alexander Knox.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Bruce Wayne. -- I've read your work. I quite like it.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Great. Give me a grant.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I might consider it if you introduce me to Miss Vale.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: "This is Miss Vale." -- That felt redundant.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: You're just back from Corto Maltese. I saw your combat photos. Quite a departure for you.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: That's intriguing. They haven't been published yet.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: ... You have an extraordinary eye.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Some people think she has two.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Don't mind my friend. He's a little nervous tonight.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I don't... seek publicity. -- Will you be staying in Gotham for a while?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: As far as I know.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Good. Then with any luck we'll run into each other.

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir. Commissioner Gordon was compelled to leave -- very unexpectedly. He asked me to convey his regrets.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Thank you, Alfred.  And you.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: I know the rich are different, but that guy is real different.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Oh. Sorry. I was thinking.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: What were you thinking?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Yum, yum.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Well, he must like the way he looks. He's got a mirror in every room.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I get it. Bruce Vain.

Speaker: patrolman
Dialogue: ... anonymous tip. Tonight. The Ace Chemical Company.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Good Lord, it we could put our hands on Jack Napier... Why wasn't I told about this? Who's in charge of the --

Speaker: patrolman
Dialogue: Lt. Eckhardt, sir.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Eckhardt. Oh my God...

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: Shoot to kill.

Speaker: safecracker
Dialogue: ... Empty.

Speaker: hood ii
Dialogue: I don't get it. If this place is cleaned out already, what do we need five men?

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: What are you trying to do, blow the collar?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Any man who opens fire on Jack Napier... will answer to me.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Freeze!

Speaker: eckhardt
Dialogue: Nice work, Commissioner.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: I'm in charge here. Not Carl Grissom.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: LOOK!

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: My God... it's him.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: HOLD IT!

Speaker: jack's voice
Dialogue: ECKHARDT!!

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: NO!!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: LOOK!

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: HOLD YOUR FIRE!

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: ... Who is this guy?

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: I don't know, but he's one hell of a showman.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Commissioner. Do us both a favor. Don't tell me some lie you'll have to retract later.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Guess who's got a date with Bruce Wayne.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Bruce Wayne? Date? He called you up and asked you for a date?... Shit.  I want you to pay close attention to this. Miranda -- tell my friend here what you told me about Bruce Wayne.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You mean Mister One-Nighter?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Yeah. "Mister One-Nighter."  Because that's the average length of his relationships with women.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The current record is almost two weeks. That cover girl -- what's her name? You must've shot her, Vicki --

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Tell her about the peanuts.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Peanuts?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Yeah. Peanuts. Which is how he goes through women.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Like Planter's Peanuts.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Plain or roasted?  Alex, I'm very flattered that you've gone out and done all this research.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Why?  Aw, come on, Vicki, I'm a reporter. I'm curious. I do this for a living. -- What'd you tell him?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I told him yes.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: ... What was that?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: That was one of the most gracious fuck-yous it's ever been my pleasure to watch. -- What a nice girl.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Miranda, I'm busy. Go be productive.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Do you sail?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Too much work. I'm not really the physical type. -- Thank you, Alfred.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: You do a very convincing imitation.  Mm, this is tasty. What's yours?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Two drinks and I start swinging from the rooftops.  Tell me, Vicki. There's something I'm very curious about. What took you down to Corto Maltese?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ... I guess I needed a change.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: You were one of the most successful magazine photographers in the city. Everyone wanted you.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Have you ever been to Corto Maltese?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Not since the shooting started.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: We went there once when I was little. I played on the beach. And at nights -- they had a band -- I danced with my father on the hotel patio.  That was Corto Maltese. When the war broke out I had to go back. And I promised myself that this time... I wouldn't look away.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: What did you see?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ... Terror.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: There's terror everywhere. Some types are just more -- familiar than others.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to -- I know it all seems a million miles away, out here on the water, with all this --

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Insulation?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Bruce, really, when I say these things I don't mean to criticize you.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I think you see things very clearly.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I'm happy to talk about something else. I don't want to be depressing.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Do you assume that if I know you better I won't like you as much?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Bruce, I have to ask. Are you like this with the other women you know? -- Because I just can't seem to get a handle on this conversation.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Vicki, if I say anything cryptic, or... ambiguous, I think you should put the most flattering possible interpretation on it. Because even if it doesn't sound that way... that's how I'll mean it.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: -- but it's not fair. I'm half drunk and you're not even --

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Would you like me to take you home?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: God. You would.  Come on, Bruce. I just want to get two drinks in you. As an experiment.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Maybe we should just kiss.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ... We could try that.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Well, Mr. Napier, let's see how we did.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: You understand the facial muscles were completely severed --

Speaker: kid
Dialogue: Nice hair, dude!

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: It's me. "Sugar Bumps."

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Thank God. I can't believe it's you. I heard you'd been --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: Is that what you "heard"?

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Sooner or later you would've tried to take me, Jack. You may get me now, but your life won't be worth a dime.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: I've died once already. It wasn't so bad. -- In fact I recommend it.

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Jack, listen -- we'll cut a deal --

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: JACK? JACK? DO I LOOK LIKE A JACK??

Speaker: grissom
Dialogue: Jack -- I'm warning you. WIPE THAT LUNATIC GRIN OFF YOUR FACE.

Speaker: jack
Dialogue: HA! That's the best part. I CAN'T!!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: What a view. Our little city. It always brings a smile to my face.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I didn't mean to scare you. I just had to come in here and see it that was really you singing.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I don't sing very well.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Then there's one thing in the world you don't do very well. And I know what it is. -- Now you'll have to kill me.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: ...Peanut.

Speaker: copy boy
Dialogue: Here's that morgue file you wanted.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Come on. Gimme some dirt!

Speaker: doorman
Dialogue: Miss Hunt!  No need to sneak in. The rent's been taken care of.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: ... The rent? Paid?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Honey -- I'm home!

Speaker: gang boss
Dialogue: So why don't we hear this from Grissom?

Speaker: racketeer
Dialogue: I got something I'd like to know. How come you're wearing that stupid smirk?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: 'Cause I got an army, chum. And I got Grissom's army. And this city is mine.

Speaker: rotelli
Dialogue: I don't like taking orders, from Grissom. And I especially don't like taking orders from Grissom's goon.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: I've considered that possibility.

Speaker: rotelli
Dialogue: And what happens if we say no?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Nobody wants a war, Carmine. If we can't do business, we shake hands and part friends.

Speaker: rotelli
Dialogue: That's it?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: That's it.

Speaker: crimelord
Dialogue: ... You're insane!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: That's what they said about Lee Iacocca. Now GET OUT OF HERE. -- And THINK IT OVER!

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ... To tell you the truth, I'd just about given up waiting.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I said I'd call you the minute I got free. And I did. -- And here we are.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Hm hmm. Lunch. Not even dinner.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Vicki. Do you want the whole truth? All coyness aside?  Now. Are you going to waste this lovely afternoon being all mad at me?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Okay, I'm a sucker. You sound so much like someone I used to...  Bruce? I know this is silly, but -- you're not married, are you?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: All street mimes should be executed.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: ... Looks like a convention.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: BRUCE!!

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Oh my God... are you all right?

Speaker: anchorwoman
Dialogue: ... live from Halliday Plaza, where a gangland-style execution claimed the life of racketeer Philly Ricorso. Ricorso's death is the third in a rash of underworld killings...

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: All reet! I think it's about time we called another meeting, huh?

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Miss Vale. I've given him your messages. That's all I can do.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Please tell him... I'm not trying to make his life difficult. I'd just -- I'd just like to know what's going on.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Hiya, peanut. I got something I'd like you to see.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Okay, here we go. Check it out.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Oh my God... I've seen this picture.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: His face. Allie, look at his face.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Yep. He watched the whole thing happen. -- Recognize the beat cop? Jim Gordon.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Oh, Bruce...

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Something like this -- what do you suppose this could drive a guy to?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Alexander, you are on drugs.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: He walks out on his own party. Half an hour later, the Caped Crusader turns up in full bat-drag.  Yeah, Vicki, he's "married" all right.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: You're pissing me off, Allie. I know exactly why you're doing this.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Oh? Why is that, Vicki?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: He's best friends with Jim Gordon and Harvey Dent. They would know.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: ... Okay, Vicki, I have a confession to make. I'm the Batman.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Alexander... I know you.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Right. And they know him. And that's why it would never occur to them for a minute that their old buddy Bruce puts on a cape at night and goes out looking for --

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: This is pointless. I'm leaving.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Next time you call him up and he can't go out Friday night -- think it over.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: How's that first shipment coming?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Mmm. How'd you find it?

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: ... of course, after Corto Maltese, this must all seem pretty tame.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Not to me. I need a job.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Now Vicki. Everyone knows you've got your hooks in Bruce Wayne.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Then "everyone" must know something I don't.

Speaker: claire
Dialogue: Oh. Really. Well. -- Come on, dear, Tony's dying to see you.

Speaker: tony
Dialogue: Yes, ladies, smiles, show me those smiles, fabulous, tropical smiles, think Tahiti, I want to see teeth, yes, those glorious teeth --

Speaker: patsy
Dialogue: The fashion world was stunned today by the sudden deaths of top models Kelly Brinkley and Christie Emberg. Cause of death has been attributed to a violent allergic reaction, although authorities have not yet ruled out the possibility of drug use. Dave?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: In Gotham, plans continue for the city's 300th birthday celebration. The four-day event will conclude with the unveiling, in Gotham Harbor, of the newly restored 'Lady Gotham'...

Speaker: director
Dialogue: WHERE'S IT COMING FROM??

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: I DON'T KNOW!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: ... new improved Joker brand. With the secret ingredient... SMYLENOL!  Let's go to our blind taste test.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: I know what you're saying. Where can I buy these fine, fine products? Well, that's the gag, folks, you never know. Chances are... you've bought 'em already!!!

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: ... Sir!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Baby's got a tummyache? Here's something that'll fix him quick!

Speaker: anchorwoman
Dialogue: ... sixteen new deaths, with no clues as to the Joker's identity or demands. The list at potentially lethal products now includes: perfume -- mascara -- cold cream --

Speaker: anchorman
Dialogue: Men's cologne toothpaste mouthwash -- underarm deodorant --

Speaker: anchorwoman
Dialogue: Hair spray -- eyebrow pencil -- moisturizing cream --

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: She's outside the Fluegelheim.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Jack? Who was that?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Get dressed. We're going out.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I'm meeting Mr. Wayne. Is he here?

Speaker: waiter
Dialogue: Miss Vale, this just arrived for you.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Okay, boys, let's broaden our minds.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: I think it's safe to take that off.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ... Thank you.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Unfortunate, but I think we can work around it.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: And you want a --

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: A visual record, yes. A before-and- after kind of thing.  This could make your reputation.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Maybe we should start with a portrait of the artist. People might like to see the face behind the makeup.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: ... Behind the makeup?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I've seen worse. Much worse.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Strong stomach, huh? I like that in a woman. -- Maybe we can do business after all.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Jack?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: WHAT?

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: You said I could look at the pictures before you -- before you --

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Shucks, honey, I forgot.  This is business, sweetie. Why don't you go outside and see how the boys are coming?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ... Why the mask?

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Alicia! Come here, have a seat. Show Miss Vale why you wear the mask.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: You SCUM! You SICK FILTH!... You DID THAT to her!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: What? I improved her a little...

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I'll see you burn. I'll see you dead. -- GET AWAY FROM ME!!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Miss Vale, was it something I said?  Do you want to sniff my flower?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Come on, Miss Vale... STOP AND SMELL THE ROSES!!

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: GET IN THE CAR!

Speaker: vicki

Dialogue: ... A hundred and eight?

Dialogue: HANG ON!

Dialogue: Did you hit her?

Dialogue: ... Not even a 'thank you'?

Dialogue: That's because you lied about your weight.  Thank you.

Dialogue: Please.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I won't let you have it.

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: The Joker is a murderer. And you were as good as dead. So --

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Look, I appreciate what you did for me. But this is my job. And I'm keeping those pictures.

Speaker: batman

Dialogue: Because I'll take you with me.

Dialogue: ... Where are you going to take me?

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: Shields open.

Dialogue: Shields open.

Dialogue: Ignition.

Dialogue: Quite a while. I took the scenic route.

Dialogue: Well, I've certainly enjoyed it. What's that?

Dialogue: Garage door.

Dialogue: I meant to ask you. Up on the roof -- how did you know my name?

Dialogue: What is this stuff? Kevlar?

Dialogue: Better. It's not on the market yet.

Dialogue: That's why I wear a target on my chest.

Dialogue: How'd you find this place?

Dialogue: Stumbled across it when I was a boy.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I don't like bats. Not that kind.

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: They used to terrify me. But I forced myself to keep coming back, and --  -- I guess I became the thing I feared the most. I'll do your photos now.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Who pays for all this?

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: I have sponsors.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: The computers?

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: I'm running a check on the tainted products. There is a pattern. Beauty products. Personal hygiene.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: No more makeup. -- Looks like we'll all be showing our true faces now.

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: I've tracked all the records. Every shipment, every warehouse, every loading dock. Nothing. No opportunities for tampering. Somehow the Joker is supplying tainted ingredients... at the source.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Wait. You can just tap into any corporate database you want? Anywhere?

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: Oh, no. I let the FBI do that. Then I tap into the FBI. -- Your photos are ready.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: You could've killed him, you know. You could have killed the Joker.

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: I had to save you, Vicki.  Here you go. I think I'll let you keep the whole set.

Dialogue: ... Bruce?

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: Are you talking to me?

Speaker: bruce

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Yes, Bruce -- I'm here --

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I'm sorry about the way things went between us. I'd very much like to see you again.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Well, Bruce... I don't think... that would be possible.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I wish you'd reconsider.  I didn't stand you up today. The museum was closed when I got there.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I, uh...

Speaker: vicki

Dialogue: Not what?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: He's not crazy.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Vicki. We got a wealthy millionaire here... who dresses up like a bat. He goes out at night and swings around -- in his cape -- on a rope.  Okay. Maybe I'm crazy.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: Allie... he wants to tell me. That's why he took me there. Because he's trying to tell me.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Gimme a break. If he wants to chat, he can talk to his car.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: He has to tell someone. And I'm the one. He's trying to tell me.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Vicki?... This is Batman. I thought I'd call and see how you're doing.

Dialogue: Hi, Bruce.

Dialogue: Harvey, please. I mean --  If your first official act as D.A. is to cut a deal with a terrorist...

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: Screw that, Ed. We've got a market panic of national proportions. -- We've got 786 people dead.  I won't sacrifice one more life for the sake of appearing strong.

Speaker: politico
Dialogue: Harvey's right. We've got the 300th anniversary gala coming up. The networks won't even send in a crew.

Speaker: adviser
Dialogue: Harvey, the police are working round the clock, the feds are coming in. This thing could break any minute now.  Tell him, Jim.

Speaker: gordon
Dialogue: Cut the deal.

Speaker: news anchor
Dialogue: ... at City Hall, where the mayor is waiting to open negotiations with the clown-faced terrorist known as the Joker. It is now eight minutes past the appointed deadline, and still no word from --

Speaker: reporter ii
Dialogue: Hey Knox, cheer up. It ain't the Batman but it's pretty choice.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Joker here. Can we talk?

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: "While this administration remains vehemently opposed to terrorism in any form, we are prepared to negotiate any reasonable demands which will guarantee the safety of the populace."

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Huh. Demands. Well, gents, this is kinda embarrassing, but... I'm having such a swell time, I just haven't thought any up.

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: All right, all right. Here's the deal. Total amnesty... and the sum of ten million dollars, payable in --

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Ten million dollars. Ten million dollars.  I want ten million and one.

Speaker: mayor
Dialogue: No, wait, please! We'll talk. Just tell us what you expect.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Goddammit, I expect to be treated like an ARTIST. GET OFF MY SCREEN!!

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Alexander Knox. Gotham Globe.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Actually, I wanted to talk to Batman. Pass that on to Mr. Wayne, would you?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I've been expecting to hear from you.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Well, that's how it is, chum. She tells me everything.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: What is it you want?

Dialogue: Simple. You know the score. One column -- and I can bring all this tumbling down. I can take you off the streets once and for all.  I want you to hang up the suit. And I want you to stay away from Vicki.

Dialogue: I can't do that. Not while the Joker's still out there.

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Then stay away from Vicki. That's all I want, man. I just want your word.

Dialogue: There's something I don't understand. If you've got the story, why haven't you printed it?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Because I --  Because she'd never speak to me again.

Dialogue: Do you want a drink?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I don't understand it. You can do so much good for people. As Bruce Wayne.

Dialogue: Money makes money, Vicki. The foundation runs itself. -- I'm extraneous to the process.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: You're one man. You can't save everybody.

Dialogue: What it I could save a handful? -- What if I could save one?

Dialogue: Sometimes... I don't know if there's enough of me left to save.

Dialogue: Head for the truck!

Dialogue: I love fireworks!

Dialogue: NO! NOOOOOOOO!!!!

Dialogue: Like your boyfriend. He's kinda hot.  Hands off the belt.

Dialogue: Take me. Let the boy go.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Gosh, I could kill you, but then you'd miss my party. And I'd be real, real sad if you couldn't make it.

Dialogue: Batman! Don't you even recognize your old pal Jack? After all...  You made me what I am today.

Dialogue: ... Where am I?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: My name is Bruce Wayne. You're welcome to stay here as long as you want.

Dialogue: He'll be ready when you do. Remember what happened at the apartment.

Dialogue: I suggest a nice big bomb.

Dialogue: Good. A bomb. On a blind tip from Bruce Wayne. -- We do have laws.

Dialogue: Then for God's sake, Harvey, cancel the anniversary celebration.

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: We've told him we'll deal. What could he possibly have to gain by --

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Do you still think the Joker cares about money??

Speaker: dent
Dialogue: I don't know. I'm just a D.A. I don't have access to all your expert sources.

Dialogue: ... Your butler wouldn't gimme a ride so I figured I'd hoof it.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Sorry. I can't let you leave.

Speaker: dick
Dialogue: You can't keep me here, man. That's kidnapping.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: If I let you leave, you'll do the same thing again. You'll go after the Joker... and you'll wind up dead.

Dialogue: Hey, man. Look at you. You're rich. You got everything you want. How do you know what's in my mind?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I don't care what's in your mind. You're staying.

Speaker: dick
Dialogue: ... You're him.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: It's all right, Alfred. Everything's under control.

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: ... Very good, sir.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Thankya, thankya. Ladies and germs, I'm here to tell you... we have had one helluva quarter.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Look at that, folks. We got 'em rolling in the aisles!

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: All this apparatus, Vicki... this house, and the money, and the power... it was never mine. It was something I inherited. Bruce Wayne was something I inherited.  All I ever hoped for was someone who could see through Bruce -- who could see me -- and not be frightened.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I'm not frightened of you, Bruce. I'm frightened for you.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: In all these years... why couldn't I see how it would turn out?

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Where's the boy?

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: Upstairs. He's quite docile.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I know that feeling. It won't last.

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: He'll be taken care of financially. Beyond that... you know what to do. Don't let all this go to waste.

Dialogue: Boston, Philly: loading bay one.

Dialogue: ... Detonate.

Dialogue: Good Lord!

Dialogue: VICKI!

Dialogue: Yeah. Deja vu.

Dialogue: What do you say? Let's head for the lights.

Dialogue: So much for Underdog.

Dialogue: ALLIE!! THE WINDOWS!!

Dialogue: WHAT HAPPENED?!?

Dialogue: Jesus Christ, the guy's a genius.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: LOOK! IT'S BRUCE!!  Allie -- the balloons. We've got to find some way to tell him!

Dialogue: Great. How??

Dialogue: GIMME A HAND UP HERE!

Dialogue: No... NOOOOO!!!

Dialogue: There. There. -- GET 'EM!!

Dialogue: HOLY SHIT!!

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah. Little winded. DID YOU SEE THAT?!

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: God yes, Allie. I've gotta say -- that was the ballsiest move I ever --

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Holy shit. Holy --

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: ALLIE!!

Speaker: knox
Dialogue: Jesus, Vicki.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: He'll be back... he'll be back!!

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: You do him. I'm outta here.

Dialogue: Yo.

Dialogue: HEY! COME ON!

Dialogue: Now we're even, huh? Even up.

Dialogue: How did you...

Dialogue: The Joker. Is he --?

Dialogue: DICK!

Dialogue: Gotham cathedral. Come and get me.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: I'm in the belltower. Don't land.

Dialogue: E.T.A. two minutes. Hang on.

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: ... Batman?

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: Mad... man...

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Well now, you're not exactly the picture of mental health, are you.

Speaker: batman
Dialogue: ... Murderer...

Speaker: joker
Dialogue: Bruce, we're both murderers. Think how many people you've killed by letting me live.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: No... sense... of humor?

Speaker: anchorwoman
Dialogue: As the details of the Joker's heinous plan become known, a city's gratitude goes out to the mysterious Batman. His whereabouts remain unknown, but Batman -- if you're alive -- if you're listening -- thank you.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I loved you too.

Speaker: alfred
Dialogue: No, Mr. Wayne is in Thailand. I'm afraid he's quite unreachable.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I don't know why I'm doing this. I half wish you'd stay a cripple.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Ohhhh... you don't mean that.

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I don't, but... I do. It's just... I love you, Bruce. I --

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: Vicki. Do you love half of me? Or all of me?

Speaker: vicki
Dialogue: I guess you did it, didn't you. You saved everyone.  Almost.

Speaker: bruce
Dialogue: I don't know how to explain this so it makes sense... but you saved me.
